result.execSummary:
The defendant John S Foggia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
--------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
--------------------

No violent contact with the victim. No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
--------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
--------------------
Pay restitution prior to plea - restitution paid in full to the victim.
--------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John S Foggia

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for John S Foggia
Current: 424 Water St., Lake Geneva, WI 53147 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 1086 S. Wells St, Lake Geneva, WI 53147 United States

Defendant John S Foggia in court.  Attorney Anthony N Flitcroft in court for John S Foggia.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA JJ Crawford. Called @ 10:02 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing .Record by Atty. Flitcroft as to the agreement of the parties. State agrees with record. Further record by Atty. Flitcroft as to 22CM468 - he has gone over the charges and penalties with the defendant who would enter not guilty pleas, but is asking that this file be included in the agreement- defendant will plead guilty to count #2.
Court goes over maximum penalties and elements of each offense and deportation warnings. Defendant responds to Court's questions as to plea questionnaire. Atty. Flitcroft responds to Court's questions regarding plea and stipulation to factual basis in each complaint. 
Defendant enters following pleas:
21-CM-140 -  GUILTY COUNT #1 AND #2
22-CM-332 - GUILTY COUNT #2.  COUNT #1 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.
Court finds defendant's pleas to be freely, knowing, and voluntary.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.
Court adopts the agreement of the parties - **SEE ATTACHED PLEA AGREEMENT.
Court in recess.

ADDRESS INFO for John S Foggia
Current: 1086 S. Wells St, Lake Geneva, WI 53147 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 23180 W Crestwood Dr, Lake Zurich, IL 60047
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM J.J.T. 9-6-1991. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John S Foggia in court. Defendant will retain attorney. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
